top_categories.workout_context: Gravel Grit 'n Grind's Gravel roads forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 50 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Gravel Grit 'n Grind's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before August.
When someone attacks on mixed gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
Gravel Grit 'n Grind's mixed gravel rewards steady threshold power. Surging and recovering costs more watts than just holding.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Gravel Grit 'n Grind, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
50 miles on mixed gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
2-minute all-out efforts on mixed gravel. Closing gaps, responding to attacks, sprinting for position. Train the burn.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Gravel Grit 'n Grind. Train it until it feels boring.
At Gravel Grit 'n Grind, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
Smooth pedaling at 50 miles saves muscle. Bad technique at mile 10 is invisible. At mile 80 it's a cramp.
Long rides with hard efforts mixed in. Simulates what Gravel Grit 'n Grind's mixed gravel actually does to you.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Gravel Grit 'n Grind’s 50 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Gravel Grit 'n Grind requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on mixed gravel to build confidence. Expect: gravel roads.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and VO2max to prepare you for 50 miles of mixed gravel in Halmstad, Sweden.
